If you're into PvP games of tag then you'll love this game.

You might think this is a horror game but the gameplay loop basically boils down to comically running around a structure before throwing a pallet down to block the killer and running to the next one, kinda like a Scooby Doo sketch or something.

You can enjoy playing the killer for some solo murder time and getting cyber bullied post match or play survivor to get chased around a wall until you die so you can cyber bully the killer afterwards.

Fun action game.

It is one of the most boring games I have ever played. Weather you play as the Killer or a Survivor you just run around a small grid tapping a few buttons to do the same tasks over and over. I know a few people that really get into playing this for stat building or whatever but I'm probably done with it after a couple rounds. Glad it was cheap to buy.
The game looks decent. The audio is good. Minimal loading time on my PC.
If you like monotonus, short, multiplayer games that lather, rinse, repeat then by all means snatch up this beauty now!

Personally, I think this game has a slight learning curve, but once you understand the objective in the game as a new player you can start to practice and get better at being a strong survivor or killer. Whatever you choose you're going to have issues with some things, the game is a little wonky in terms of matchmaking, general game balance, but it has a solid foundation and IMHO a great dev team that is very much devoted to listening to making the game better even if sometimes they might make the wrong decisions. 

This game is great for lovers of the horror genre in movies and basically you get to play whatever killer you want that are both LICENSED movie stars and vague off-brand takes on popular horror movie characters. From Michael Myers to Freddy Kreuger, I mean what other game provides you with this kind of unique gameplay? The community is a bit toxic but not really near the levels of something like League of Legends because this game is not a competitive game. It can be at times due to the nature of competitive people and the forming of SWF (Survive With Friends) but the game is not taken that seriously for the most part. So, if you have an open mind and are willing to die a bunch to get better at the game then this game is right for you. 

If you have issues with team based games then this may not be for you. Graphics are okay, the sound design is really good, there is lore related to how your characters arrived in the fog but it's not in your face about it as it puts multiplayer PVP at the highest pedestal. 

I would generally recommend this game to horror genre fans who wants something new and refreshing to play.
